t: Luke 11
And*p it came to pass, that, as he was praying in a certain place, when he ceased, one of his disciples said unto him, Lord, teach us to pray, as John also taught his disciples.

And*p he said unto them, When ye pray, say, Our*r Father*r which*r art*r in*r heaven,*r Hallowed*r be*r thy*r name.*r Thy*r kingdom*r come.*r Thy*r will*r be*r done,*r as*r in*r heaven,*r so*r in*r earth.*r
Give*rp us*r day*r by*r day*r our*r daily*r bread.*r
And*rp forgive*r us*r our*r sins;*r for*r we*r also*r forgive*r every*r one*r that*r is*r indebted*r to*r us.*r And*r lead*r us*r not*r into*r temptation;*r but*r deliver*r us*r from*r evil.*r
And*p he said unto them, Which*r of*r you*r shall*r have*r a*r friend,*r and*r shall*r go*r unto*r him*r at*r midnight,*r and*r say*r unto*r him,*r Friend,*r lend*r me*r three*r loaves;*r
For*rp a*r friend*r of*r mine*r in*r his*r journey*r is*r come*r to*r me,*r and*r I*r have*r nothing*r to*r set*r before*r him?*r

And*rp he*r from*r within*r shall*r answer*r and*r say,*r Trouble*r me*r not:*r the*r door*r is*r now*r shut,*r and*r my*r children*r are*r with*r me*r in*r bed;*r I*r cannot*r rise*r and*r give*r thee.*r

I*rp say*r unto*r you,*r Though*r he*r will*r not*r rise*r and*r give*r him,*r because*r he*r is*r his*r friend,*r yet*r because*r of*r his*r importunity*r he*r will*r rise*r and*r give*r him*r as*r many*r as*r he*r needeth.*r
And*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r Ask,*r and*r it*r shall*r be*r given*r you;*r seek,*r and*r ye*r shall*r find;*r knock,*r and*r it*r shall*r be*r opened*r unto*r you.*r
For*rp every*r one*r that*r asketh*r receiveth;*r and*r he*r that*r seeketh*r findeth;*r and*r to*r him*r that*r knocketh*r it*r shall*r be*r opened.*r

If*rp a*r son*r shall*r ask*r bread*r of*r any*r of*r you*r that*r is*r a*r father,*r will*r he*r give*r him*r a*r stone?*r or*r if*r he*r ask*r a*r fish,*r will*r he*r for*r a*r fish*r give*r him*r a*r serpent?*r
Or*rp if*r he*r shall*r ask*r an*r egg,*r will*r he*r offer*r him*r a*r scorpion?*r

If*rp ye*r then,*r being*r evil,*r know*r how*r to*r give*r good*r gifts*r unto*r your*r children:*r how*r much*r more*r shall*r your*r heavenly*r Father*r give*r the*r Holy*r Spirit*r to*r them*r that*r ask*r him?*r
And*p he was casting out a devil, and it was dumb. And it came to pass, when the devil was gone out, the dumb spake; and the people wondered.
But*p some of them said, He casteth out devils through Beelzebub the chief of the devils.
And*p others, tempting him, sought of him a sign from heaven.
But*p he, knowing their thoughts, said unto them, Every*r kingdom*r divided*r against*r itself*r is*r brought*r to*r desolation;*r and*r a*r house*r divided*r against*r a*r house*r falleth.*r
If*rp Satan*r also*r be*r divided*r against*r himself,*r how*r shall*r his*r kingdom*r stand?*r because*r ye*r say*r that*r I*r cast*r out*r devils*r through*r Beelzebub.*r
And*rp if*r I*r by*r Beelzebub*r cast*r out*r devils,*r by*r whom*r do*r your*r sons*r cast*r them*r out?*r therefore*r shall*r they*r be*r your*r judges.*r
But*rp if*r I*r with*r the*r finger*r of*r God*r cast*r out*r devils,*r no*r doubt*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r is*r come*r upon*r you.*r
When*rp a*r strong*r man*r armed*r keepeth*r his*r palace,*r his*r goods*r are*r in*r peace:*r

But*rp when*r a*r stronger*r than*r he*r shall*r come*r upon*r him,*r and*r overcome*r him,*r he*r taketh*r from*r him*r all*r his*r armour*r wherein*r he*r trusted,*r and*r divideth*r his*r spoils.*r
He*rp that*r is*r not*r with*r me*r is*r against*r me:*r and*r he*r that*r gathereth*r not*r with*r me*r scattereth.*r

When*rp the*r unclean*r spirit*r is*r gone*r out*r of*r a*r man,*r he*r walketh*r through*r dry*r places,*r seeking*r rest;*r and*r finding*r none,*r he*r saith,*r I*r will*r return*r unto*r my*r house*r whence*r I*r came*r out.*r
And*rp when*r he*r cometh,*r he*r findeth*r it*r swept*r and*r garnished.*r

Then*rp goeth*r he,*r and*r taketh*r to*r him*r seven*r other*r spirits*r more*r wicked*r than*r himself;*r and*r they*r enter*r in,*r and*r dwell*r there:*r and*r the*r last*r state*r of*r that*r man*r is*r worse*r than*r the*r first.*r
And*p it came to pass, as he spake these things, a certain woman of the company lifted up her voice, and said unto him, Blessed is the womb that bare thee, and the paps which thou hast sucked.
But*p he said, Yea*r rather,*r blessed*r are*r they*r that*r hear*r the*r word*r of*r God,*r and*r keep*r it.*r

And*p when the people were gathered thick together, he began to say, This*r is*r an*r evil*r generation:*r they*r seek*r a*r sign;*r and*r there*r shall*r no*r sign*r be*r given*r it,*r but*r the*r sign*r of*r Jonas*r the*r prophet.*r
For*rp as*r Jonas*r was*r a*r sign*r unto*r the*r Ninevites,*r so*r shall*r also*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r be*r to*r this*r generation.*r

The*rp queen*r of*r the*r south*r shall*r rise*r up*r in*r the*r judgment*r with*r the*r men*r of*r this*r generation,*r and*r condemn*r them:*r for*r she*r came*r from*r the*r utmost*r parts*r of*r the*r earth*r to*r hear*r the*r wisdom*r of*r Solomon;*r and,*r behold,*r a*r greater*r than*r Solomon*r is*r here.*r

The*rp men*r of*r Nineve*r shall*r rise*r up*r in*r the*r judgment*r with*r this*r generation,*r and*r shall*r condemn*r it:*r for*r they*r repented*r at*r the*r preaching*r of*r Jonas;*r and,*r behold,*r a*r greater*r than*r Jonas*r is*r here.*r

No*rp man,*r when*r he*r hath*r lighted*r a*r candle,*r putteth*r it*r in*r a*r secret*r place,*r neither*r under*r a*r bushel,*r but*r on*r a*r candlestick,*r that*r they*r which*r come*r in*r may*r see*r the*r light.*r

The*rp light*r of*r the*r body*r is*r the*r eye:*r therefore*r when*r thine*r eye*r is*r single,*r thy*r whole*r body*r also*r is*r full*r of*r light;*r but*r when*r thine*r eye*r is*r evil,*r thy*r body*r also*r is*r full*r of*r darkness.*r
Take*rp heed*r therefore*r that*r the*r light*r which*r is*r in*r thee*r be*r not*r darkness.*r

If*rp thy*r whole*r body*r therefore*r be*r full*r of*r light,*r having*r no*r part*r dark,*r the*r whole*r shall*r be*r full*r of*r light,*r as*r when*r the*r bright*r shining*r of*r a*r candle*r doth*r give*r thee*r light.*r
And*p as he spake, a certain Pharisee besought him to dine with him: and he went in, and sat down to meat.
And*p when the Pharisee saw it, he marvelled that he had not first washed before dinner.

And*p the Lord said unto him, Now*r do*r ye*r Pharisees*r make*r clean*r the*r outside*r of*r the*r cup*r and*r the*r platter;*r but*r your*r inward*r part*r is*r full*r of*r ravening*r and*r wickedness.*r
Ye*rp fools,*r did*r not*r he*r that*r made*r that*r which*r is*r without*r make*r that*r which*r is*r within*r also?*r
But*rp rather*r give*r alms*r of*r such*r things*r as*r ye*r have;*r and,*r behold,*r all*r things*r are*r clean*r unto*r you.*r

But*rp woe*r unto*r you,*r Pharisees!*r for*r ye*r tithe*r mint*r and*r rue*r and*r all*r manner*r of*r herbs,*r and*r pass*r over*r judgment*r and*r the*r love*r of*r God:*r these*r ought*r ye*r to*r have*r done,*r and*r not*r to*r leave*r the*r other*r undone.*r
Woe*rp unto*r you,*r Pharisees!*r for*r ye*r love*r the*r uppermost*r seats*r in*r the*r synagogues,*r and*r greetings*r in*r the*r markets.*r
Woe*rp unto*r you,*r scribes*r and*r Pharisees,*r hypocrites!*r for*r ye*r are*r as*r graves*r which*r appear*r not,*r and*r the*r men*r that*r walk*r over*r them*r are*r not*r aware*r of*r them.*r
Then*p answered one of the lawyers, and said unto him, Master, thus saying thou reproachest us also.

And*p he said, Woe*r unto*r you*r also,*r ye*r lawyers!*r for*r ye*r lade*r men*r with*r burdens*r grievous*r to*r be*r borne,*r and*r ye*r yourselves*r touch*r not*r the*r burdens*r with*r one*r of*r your*r fingers.*r
Woe*rp unto*r you!*r for*r ye*r build*r the*r sepulchres*r of*r the*r prophets,*r and*r your*r fathers*r killed*r them.*r
Truly*rp ye*r bear*r witness*r that*r ye*r allow*r the*r deeds*r of*r your*r fathers:*r for*r they*r indeed*r killed*r them,*r and*r ye*r build*r their*r sepulchres.*r
Therefore*rp also*r said*r the*r wisdom*r of*r God,*r I*r will*r send*r them*r prophets*r and*r apostles,*r and*r some*r of*r them*r they*r shall*r slay*r and*r persecute:*r
That*rp the*r blood*r of*r all*r the*r prophets,*r which*r was*r shed*r from*r the*r foundation*r of*r the*r world,*r may*r be*r required*r of*r this*r generation;*r

From*rp the*r blood*r of*r Abel*r unto*r the*r blood*r of*r Zacharias,*r which*r perished*r between*r the*r altar*r and*r the*r temple:*r verily*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r It*r shall*r be*r required*r of*r this*r generation.*r
Woe*rp unto*r you,*r lawyers!*r for*r ye*r have*r taken*r away*r the*r key*r of*r knowledge:*r ye*r entered*r not*r in*r yourselves,*r and*r them*r that*r were*r entering*r in*r ye*r hindered.*r
And*p as he said these things unto them, the scribes and the Pharisees began to urge him vehemently, and to provoke him to speak of many things:
Laying*p wait for him, and seeking to catch something out of his mouth, that they might accuse him.
